Question: This person claimed the hangings were "revenge" while noting the strong public sentiment "that there has been hanging enough".
Hints: John C Miller notes that after failing to gain agreement on any of these, this person resigned in December 1793.
This person viewed English colonists were compelled to rely on "common sense" and rediscover the "laws of nature".
Although opposed to the international slave trade, this person sometimes bought slaves and often sold them.
